definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: You could put half of Trump"s supporters into what I call the basket of deplorables."
sentences.chinese: 特朗普的半數支持者都是‘一籮筐可憐蟲’。

sentences.english: In the world, there are many kinds of wretches.
sentences.chinese: 這世上有各種不同的可憐蟲。

sentences.english: We are a couple of no-nameslobs.
sentences.chinese: 我們不過是一對可憐蟲。

sentences.english: You only did it so you’d have one more poor sucker to tax.
sentences.chinese: 你這樣做的目的只是爲了增加一個向你繳稅的可憐蟲。

sentences.english: I pity them, these poor unenlightened souls.
sentences.chinese: 我真同情他們，這些無知的可憐蟲。

sentences.english: By most accounts Meiwes was a depraved and pathetic individual from Roteburg, Germany.
sentences.chinese: 邁韋斯，德國羅滕堡人，據說是個墮落的可憐蟲。

sentences.english: The poor bastard of a driver could freeze out there .
sentences.chinese: 司機那個可憐蟲該凍壞了。

sentences.english: They have no suspicion that they are to be pitied.
sentences.chinese: 他們並沒猜想到自己是可憐蟲。
